alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Dry Fuels, Marginally Low Relative Humidity, and Breezy to Gusty Winds will Increase Fire Weather Concerns Tuesday... * After a day of dry, breezy conditions, fine fuels are a mix of near critically dry or at critically dry levels across the St. Lawrence Valley and locations along US Highway 11 towards Malone and Ellenburg Depot in northern New York according to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation. The combination of low relative humidity values between 30 to 35 percent and gusty southwest winds of 25 to 40 mph, may lead to increase fire weather concerns late Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. The period of strongest winds and lowest relative humidity values are expected from noon and 5 PM. If any fires were to start, the weather and localized fuel conditions may result in rapid fire spread. * For more information about the current fire danger rating, any burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website. * Remember, a burn ban is in effect for all of New York through May 14th, which means no open burning is allowed.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
